name: dribbling
content:
dribbling noun [U]
(MOVING BALL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the skill of moving a ball along the ground with repeated small kicks or hits, or (in basketball) of moving a ball by repeatedly hitting it so it bounces off the floor: He's good at shooting, passing, and dribbling. I put in the work, practicing dribbling and shooting.
More examplesFewer examplesI would head to the YMCA to work on my left-hand dribbling.He reserved chunks of practice time for pivoting, free-throw shooting, passing, dribbling and other basic techniques. Adu put on a phenomenal dribbling display along the end line.

dribbling noun [U]
(FROM MOUTH)
UK (US drooling) the fact of having liquid slowly coming out of your mouth: Dribbling is caused by excess saliva in the mouth.
More examplesFewer examplesHe hated everything about babies - their crying, dribbling, and dirty nappies.Hypersalivation is increased saliva in the mouth, sometimes with dribbling at night.
